sudoku.app.model

Class Grid

  • java.lang.Object
    • sudoku.app.model.Grid

  • public class Grid
extends java.lang.Object
    Author:
    Martin Zokov The Class Grid. Represents the sudoku 9 x 9 grid with a 2D array of Cell objects.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      boolean solved
      A boolean variable to show if the puzzle is solved or not.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Grid()
      Instantiates a new grid.

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void findCandidates()
      Method which goes through the whole grid and eliminates candidates which can't be the value of the cell
      Cell[][] getGrid()
      Gets the grid.
      void hiddenSingles()
      Hidden singles algorithm which checks a cell and it's candidates.
      boolean isLoaded()
      Checks if is loaded.
      int isSolved()
      Checks if the puzzle is solved.
      void loadGrid(java.lang.String file)
      Loads a grid file.
      void nakedPairs()
      Naked pairs algorithm.
      void nakedSingles()
      Naked singles algorithm simply looks for cells which have only one possible candidate and sets it as the value.
      void printCandidatesGrid()
      Prints the candidates grid to the console.
      void printGrid()
      Prints the grid to the console.
      void solve()
      The solve method uses 3 algorithms to solve the grid.
      void stop()
      Stop method to change the boolean solved so that it can be used as a pause button for the solver thread.

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        equals, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Field Detail

      • solved

        public boolean solved
        A boolean variable to show if the puzzle is solved or not. Also used for pausing the solver thread.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Grid

        public Grid()
        Instantiates a new grid. Creates the grid array and fills it with Cell objects.

    • Method Detail

      • getGrid

        public Cell[][] getGrid()
        Gets the grid. Used to pass it on to the GUI.
        Returns:
        Returns the whole grid.

      • solve

        public void solve()
        The solve method uses 3 algorithms to solve the grid. Goes through all 3 of them and refreshes the candidates list for every cell. Pauses the solver thread while running.

      • isSolved

        public int isSolved()
        Checks if the puzzle is solved. Goes through the grid and counts the solved cells.
        Returns:
        integer with the total number of solved cells.

      • printGrid

        public void printGrid()
        Prints the grid to the console. Used for debugging while implementing algorithms.

      • printCandidatesGrid

        public void printCandidatesGrid()
        Prints the candidates grid to the console. Used for debugging while implementing algorithms.

      • nakedPairs

        public void nakedPairs()
        Naked pairs algorithm. Goes through the cells on the board, looks for two cells that have the same pair of candidates. If it finds such cells, it then eliminates those two candidates from all cells in the same row/column/sub-grid, depending on where the cells are

      • hiddenSingles

        public void hiddenSingles()
        Hidden singles algorithm which checks a cell and it's candidates. If one of the candidates occurs only once on a row/column/sub-grid, then this candidate must be placed there.

      • nakedSingles

        public void nakedSingles()
        Naked singles algorithm simply looks for cells which have only one possible candidate and sets it as the value.

      • findCandidates

        public void findCandidates()
        Method which goes through the whole grid and eliminates candidates which can't be the value of the cell

      • loadGrid

        public void loadGrid(java.lang.String file)
              throws java.io.IOException
        Loads a grid file. Reads the lines as strings, makes them a char array and puts them into the grid cells.
        Parameters:
        file - A string with the file path for the file
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - Signals that an I/O exception has occurred.

      • isLoaded

        public boolean isLoaded()
        Checks if is loaded.
        Returns:
        true, if a file is loaded

      • stop

        public void stop()
        Stop method to change the boolean solved so that it can be used as a pause button for the solver thread.
